SEARCH
Package gridgames

Class Game

java.lang.Object
gridgames.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SameGame
public abstract class Game extends Object implements Serializable
Class which holds the common logic for all games built uppon the gridgames package.

The class repsonsabilities are to notify its listeners classes through the event mechanism, make common operations on a Grid object and make common operations determining the state of the game.

NOTE: This class has been created with the idea of making a framework allowing the user to build its own 2D-style puzzle games, but it has not been achieved yet.

NOTE: The Game instance is the "Model" of the Model-View-Controller pattern used to design this project.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Constructor for Game class. Must be used by all subclasses.

      The work of this constructor is to initialize the game state and make it possible to add listeners to it.

      See Also:
      • addListener(GameListener)

  • Method Details

    • setGameParameters

      protected abstract void setGameParameters()
      Provides the ability to make a custom implementation to initialize this Game.

      E.g. to replace default values set by this Game.

    • generateGrid

      protected abstract Grid generateGrid()
      Builds and returns a new Grid for this Game.

      E.g. to make a different Grid according to the level of difficulty.

      Returns:
      A newly allocated Grid object.

    • checkWin

      public abstract boolean checkWin()
      Checks whether the user won the game or not.
      Returns:
      true if the user won the game, false otherwise.

    • checkLose

      public abstract boolean checkLose()
      Checks whether the user lost the game or not.
      Returns:
      true if the user lost the game, false otherwise.

    • computeScoreInc

      protected abstract void computeScoreInc()
      Computes the amount of points given by the user selection.

      Allows the programmer to provide cutom scoring rules.

    • makeListenable

      public final void makeListenable()
      Re-enables the possibility to add listeners to this Game after deserialization.

      The listeners of this Game are not serialized, thus must be added again to the deserialized game.

      See Also:
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • FileManager

    • addListener

      public final void addListener(GameListener listener)
      Adds a new listener object to this Game and set it properly to listen to this Game.
      Parameters:
      listener - An object which implements the GameListener interface.
      See Also:
      • GameListener

    • makeNew

      public final void makeNew()
      Sets a new playable environment held by this Game, for the user.

      This method requires an implentation of setGameParameters() and generateGrid() to be used by Game subclasses.

      Also notifies all listeners of an EventType.BEGIN event.

      See Also:
      • setGameParameters()
      • generateGrid()
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

    • reset

      public final void reset()
      Resets the current playable environment by setting the score to 0 and generating a new Grid.

      This method requires an implentation of generateGrid() to be used by Game subclasses.

      Also notifies all listeners of an EventType.RESET event.

      See Also:
      • generateGrid()
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

    • reset

      public final void reset(Difficulty difficulty)
      Resets the current playable environment by setting the score to 0 and generating a new Grid according to a given level of difficulty.

      This method requires an implentation of generateGrid() to be used by Game subclasses.

      Also notifies all listeners of an EventType.RESET event.

      Parameters:
      difficulty - The level of difficulty to reset this Game with, as a Difficulty enumeration.
      See Also:
      • generateGrid()
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

      • EventType

    • findBestMove

      public final void findBestMove()
      Finds the best move the user can play to score the highest number of points on the current round.

      Also saves the amount of points in scoreInc and notifies all listeners of an EventType.HINT event.

      See Also:
      • scoreInc
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

    • selectionAt

      public final void selectionAt(int r, int c)
      Selects tiles on the Grid of this Game based on the user's choice and computes the amount of points made by the user's selection.

      Relies on a computeScoreInc() implementation to be used by Game subclasses.

      Also notifies all listeners of an EventType.PRE_VALID event.

      Parameters:
      r - The row coordinate of the user's selection, as an int.
      c - The column coordinate of the user's selection, as an int.
      See Also:
      • computeScoreInc()
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

    • validateSelection

      public final void validateSelection()
      Removes selected tiles on the Grid of this Game, increases the score and checks for end game conditions.

      Relies on checkWin() and checkLose() implementations to be used by Game subclasses.

      Also notifies all listeners of:

      • an EventType.WIN event if the user won the game,
      • an EventType.LOSE event if the user lost the game,
      • an EventType.NEXT_MOVE event if none of the above conditions is met.
      See Also:
      • checkWin()
      • checkLose()
      • addListener(GameListener)
      • EventType

    • inputRequest

      public final void inputRequest(String requestText)
      Notifies all listeners of an EventType.INPUT event, with an additional text to send.
      Parameters:
      requestText - Additionnal text to send, as a String.
      See Also:

    • getListeners

      public final List<GameListener> getListeners()
      Returns an unmodifiable list of the listeners belonging to this Game, as a List<GameListener>.

      NOTE: The list this method returns is unmodifiable, meaning that listeners cannot be added, removed, or replaced. However, it does not avoid mutable listeners to be modified. The getListeners() method exists only to allow the FileManager class to be able to recover the listeners of this Game to add them back to a deserialized Game, but it is kind of a security breach. A solution would be to aggregate the FileManager class in the Game, instead of making it a listener, and to modifiy its methods to manipulate less data and achieve a better encapsulation.

      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of the listeners belonging to this Game, or null if the list of listeners is null.
      See Also:
      • GameListener
      • FileManager

    • increaseScore

      protected final void increaseScore()
      Increases the score of this Game by a known amount of points set by scoreInc.

    • selectedTilesNumber

      protected final int selectedTilesNumber()
      Returns the number of selected Tiles object within the Grid of this Game as an int.
      Returns:
      The number of selected Tiles object within the Grid of this Game.

    • isGridInitialized

      public final boolean isGridInitialized()
      Checks whether the Grid object of this Game is null or not.
      Returns:
      true if the Grid of this Game is not null, false otherwise.
